page.title: 05St Andrew's Church
page.content: The church's priory name is{Le Rice}. Inside the lynch gate there was a plaque which said,"{Built in 1109. {Rebuilt by Norman Cooper.Born 1902, {died 1976.}" The church itself has still got its very old door which is nine hundred years old and was there in{Norman {times}.Before sailors went off to war they would go to the church and with their penknives they would make a line on the door. After the war,if the sailors survived,they went back to the church and made another line so that both lines made a cross. This was a sign of thanks that God had guided them safely through the war. The church is quite big and at one end of it there is a{spiral staircase. Under the stone floor in the church there are people buried.
